# Electron worker

Create a `worker` process from the master process to establish a two-way connection. 
As well as unifying the management of all `worker` processes

---

## Browser Process

---

### worker.create(name)

- `name`: (`string`) Name of the worker

Creates a new worker.

```typescript
worker.create('test');
```

---

### worker.close(name, force)

- `name`: (`string`) Name of the worker
- `force`: (`boolean`) Whether to force close, default is false

Closes the specified worker.

```typescript
worker.close('test');
```

---

### worker.clear(force)

- `force`: (`boolean`) Whether to force close, default is false

Clears all workers.

```typescript
worker.close('test');
```

---

### worker.query(name)

- `name`: (`string`) Name of the worker

Query an existing worker.

```typescript
worker.query('test');
```

---

### worker.queryAll()

Query all workers.

```typescript
worker.queryAll();
```

---

### worker.forEach(handle)

Iterate through all workers.

```typescript
worker.forEach((worker: Worker) => {
    console.log(worker);
});
```

---
